page.title: 08MORE SHOPS IN N.FERRIBY.
page.content: On the Low Street there is a green grocer's,a fish and chip shop and a wool shop and further along the street is a butcher's, a baker's and a general store . Opposite the Church there is a post office,a Mace Store,a chemist,a fruit and vegetable shop and a newsagent's. We interviewed certain key shop owners and found the main influence upon their shops has been the opening of a Sainsbury's Store in Hessle 7 miles away.Many families do the week's shopping at Sainsbury's and use the village shops for fresh foods and any food they have forgotten and need in a hurry.Prices in the village tend to be higher reflecting the slower turnover.
